ovdesc.p: This table identifies the Languages that may be used on the System when defining multilanguage fields.

The Abbreviation code assigned to each Language is used as a screen prompt when displaying multilanguage fields. To enable these prompts to be meaningful to the operator, it is recommended that a code is used which is the same as, or similar to the Country code associated with that Language.
This table must be set up first when installing the General Tables.

desc.p: Allows the specification of the minimum length to be used in validation for manadatory language fields of the specified language code.

In English many mandatory language fields such as descriptions are defined to accept a minimum of 3 characters. However in certain languages such as Korean or Chinese only a single character is required to give a meaningful description.
By specifying a value in this field the minimum value can be made as short (minimum 1 character) or as long as is appropriate. This validation will only be applied when the field is mandatory.
1 or 2 numeric characters
Indicates the Abbreviation to be used for the Language.
The Abbreviation to be used throughout T24 for each language is indicated by this field. It is also the screen prompt that will be displayed for the Language.
2 type MNE characters (uppercase alpha or numeric or '.'). (Mandatory input)
The first character must be A-Z.
Each Language Mnemonic must be different.
Description
Specifies the universally standard two letter language code, as defined by ISO 639-1, to identify the locale.
(ISO 639 is a standardized nomenclature, that is used to classify all known languages)
This is the code by which the Language can be identified.
New languages must be added sequentially, in the table e.g. Language 6 may not be specified unless Language 5 has previously been defined and authorised.
Note : The user should use the language code '1' for English since all error messages and text are written in English and no translation is performed on this code.
1-2 numeric characters. (Mandatory input) The code must be in the range 1-12.

t.desc:
Specifies the separators to be used when formatting amounts for Enquiry, Repgen & screen input.
This field specifies the separators to be used when formatting amounts. Input of '
,. ' will use commas to separate the thousands and a full stop for the decimal place. Whilst input of '
.,' will use a comma decimal place separator and full stop for thousands. These two methods are the most common '
,.' is used in the United Kingdom whilst on the Continent the '
.,' is preferred.
For certain uses the separators can be set to use an apostrophe with either the comma or full stop.
Here are some examples:
SettingUnformatted AmountFormatted Amount
,.1234512,345.00
,.1234567.891,234,567.89
.,1234512.345,00
.,1234567.891.234.567,89
'.1234512'345.00
'.1234567.891'234'567.89
',1234512'345,00
',1234567.891'234'567,89
Validation Rules:
2 alpha, comma, full stop or apostrophe. Any combination of 2 can be used. (Optional input)
Must be either comma, full stop or apostophe.
The same character cannot be used twice.
The default is '
,.'
